CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 24, 1962, pg. 35 reads: "Burke's Hall - Located on the second floor of the Rhumba Theatre (so named after the Soltz family took possession of the entire property in 1935) was Burke's Hall. Dancing classes were held on Monday nights.  Thursday afternoons and nights, Saturday nights and all holidays, for an admission price of 35c.  Here, thousands of youngsters learned their first lessons in how to keep their right and left feet from becoming tangled.  The hall was located almost in center of a growing Negro population. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Exterior of Rhumba Theatre seen from across street, Fullerton Street, Hill District
